page.title: 02Historical Figures
page.content: Ecclefechan is a small village with a population of approximately 590.One of the most noteworthy points of the village is it is the birthplace of Thomas Carlyle.Thomas Carlyle, historian, essayist and social reformer, was born on 4th December 1795 in an arched house on the village mainstreet.It is significant that at his death in 1881 Carlyles instuctions were to refuse a place with the nations great in Westminister Abbey. Instead he was buried, with his parents, in Hoddom Churchyard, a few hundred yards from his birthplace. Doctor A Arnott,Napoleons surgeon and Robert Peel the grandfather of Sir Robert Peel are also to be found in this cemetery.Robert Burns is also known to have stayed in the village and wrote the poem ,The Lass of Ecclefechan.
